org.tinfour.demo.viewer.backplane

Class ModelFromLas

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tinfour.demo.viewer.backplane.ModelAdapter
      • org.tinfour.demo.viewer.backplane.ModelFromLas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IModel

    public class ModelFromLas
extends ModelAdapter
implements IModel
    A model for managing data taken from a Lidar (LAS) file.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int GROUND_POINT
      The classification for ground-points as given in the ASPRS LAS file-format specification.

      • Fields inherited from class org.tinfour.demo.viewer.backplane.ModelAdapter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ModelFromLas(File file, LidarPointSelection lidarPointSelection)
      Construct a model tied to the specified file with filtering based on classification (only points of specified class are accepted).

      • GROUND_POINT

        public static final int GROUND_POINT
        The classification for ground-points as given in the ASPRS LAS file-format specification.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModelFromLas

        public ModelFromLas(File file,
                    LidarPointSelection lidarPointSelection)
        Construct a model tied to the specified file with filtering based on classification (only points of specified class are accepted).
        Parameters:
        file - a valid LAS file
        lidarPointSelection - a specification for selecting lidar points based on their classification or other elements.

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load(org.tinfour.common.IMonitorWithCancellation monitor)
          throws IOException
        Read the standard header of the LAS file associated with this model and all internal records to create a collection of vertices.
        Specified by:
        load in interface IModel
        Overrides:
        load in class ModelAdapter
        Parameters:
        monitor - an optional monitor for tracking progress (null if not used)
        Throws:
        IOException - In the event of a non-recoverable error related to I/O or file access.

      • getLinearUnits

        public org.tinfour.utils.LinearUnits getLinearUnits()
        Gets the linear units for the coordinate system used by the data. It is assumed that the vertical and horizontal coordinate systems will be in the same unit system, though assumption could change in a future implementation.
        Specified by:
        getLinearUnits in interface IModel
